TopicTitle: Joystick found but ignored (blank pane in settings)

Articles.Content:
XP SP3, KSP 0.90 32bit

Thrustmaster Flightstick X

I used this joystick plenty of times before with KSP... from sometime around 0.20 up to 0.24.x. I didn't test 0.25 and went straight to 0.90 today. The right pane in the input settings is completely empty. I suppose that's what happens when no stick is detected.

However, it is detected according to the relevant section of the output log:

[HighLogic]: =========================== Scene Change : From MAINMENU to SETTINGS =====================

(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/d63dfc6385190b60/artifacts/StandalonePlayerGenerated/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 49)

(Filename: Line: 1633)

(Filename: Line: 1633)

(Filename: Line: 1633)

Total: 208.487946 ms (FindLiveObjects: 13.563176 ms CreateObjectMapping: 7.391442 ms MarkObjects: 182.949509 ms DeleteObjects: 4.035708 ms)

(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/d63dfc6385190b60/artifacts/StandalonePlayerGenerated/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 49)

Joystick Names:

0: T.Flight Stick X

(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/d63dfc6385190b60/artifacts/StandalonePlayerGenerated/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 49)

HighlightingSystem : Edge Highlighting requires AA to work!

(Filename: C:/BuildAgent/work/d63dfc6385190b60/artifacts/StandalonePlayerGenerated/UnityEngineDebug.cpp Line: 49)

[HighLogic]: =========================== Scene Change : From SETTINGS to MAINMENU =====================

Instead, what might be the problem is that there are some errors about different classes of settings. Or maybe that's normal, i'm not sure.

The only other part in the output log that is not plain status or loading messages, is close to the top:

...

Platform assembly: d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\XmlDiffPatch.View.dll (this message is harmless)

Loading d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\XmlDiffPatch.View.dll into Unity Child Domain

Platform assembly: d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\TDx.TDxInput.dll (this message is harmless)

Loading d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\TDx.TDxInput.dll into Unity Child Domain

<RI> Initializing input.

<RI> Input initialized.

desktop: 1920x1080 60Hz; virtual: 1920x1080 at 0,0

Platform assembly: d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\System.Core.dll (this message is harmless)

Platform assembly: d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\System.dll (this message is harmless)

Platform assembly: d:\KSP-90\KSP_Data\Managed\System.Xml.dll (this message is harmless)

...

The joystick does respond in window's control panel, and also works in other games. I removed everything from the gameplay dir, including the nasa mod, so that only the squad folder remained. Replugging into a different USB port also doesnt change anything.

- - - Updated - - -

*head at wall*

There is no bug. It's just that the settings were changed, so that joystick settings only appear in 2 of the various pages. Apparently, i missed those two when clicking through pages.
